The speaker, Jacques Pepin, explains the process of cooking spinach, which involves washing the spinach, chopping garlic, sauting the garlic in oil, adding the spinach to the skillet, seasoning with salt and pepper, and finishing with butter. The steps are extracted based on the sequence of actions described by the speaker.
dish_description: The dish is a simple sauted spinach with garlic, seasoned with salt and pepper, and finished with a touch of butter. It's a quick and easy side dish suitable for two to three people.

cooking_steps.description: Finely chop a tablespoon and a half of garlic.
Heat a skillet with a tablespoon to a tablespoon and a half of oil, then add the chopped garlic to the skillet, making sure not to burn it.
Add half a pound of washed spinach on top of the garlic in the skillet.
Stir the spinach, turning it over to prevent the garlic from burning and to distribute the garlic evenly.
Add the rest of the spinach to the skillet, noting that the moisture from the washed spinach will help it cook down.
Season the spinach with a dash of salt and pepper.
Cover the skillet to increase moisture and help the spinach break down, shaking occasionally to ensure even wilting.
Finish the dish by adding a couple of teaspoons of butter, then let it cook uncovered to evaporate some of the moisture. The dish is ready when the spinach is wilted and cooked to preference.
